tutorial_start.initiate:
Hey you Player! The person
controlling me! This is a
simple text tutorial! If you need 
to know the basics here is the info!

If you want to find
out more press "NEXT"
tutorial_start.response:
Hello! I am you onboard computer 
for this game! I will answer any of your 
questions that I have
decided you can ask me!

To ask questions press NEXT,
then click any of the 3
options available.

How does the turn system work?.initiate:
How does the turn system work? 
Also what are actions?
response:
The turn system allows the player to take
actions based on their
initiative. The higher your
initiative the more actions
you can take but the lower in the turn
order you go.

Every round every actor in the
game "You, and the enemies"
are ordered from lowest to
highest based on your
initiative.

actions are certain things you can do
with your initiative.

How do I take an actions?.initiate: What are actions? and how do I take them?
response:
An action is something your character
or an enemy can
do. they all cost some
amount of initiative.

To take an action you must hover 
over a valid tile. When you do a small
tab will show up. This shows you 
everything that you can do 
with this tile. Using the
Scroll wheel you can look at all the
possible actions.

when you have
decided on an action simply
follow the prompt and click
either LMB or RMB.
Currently you can take 4 actions.

Move. This moves
you to the tile of your
choice or the closest tile
you can reach. Each tile
costs 1 initiative.

Use. This
allows you to interact with
POI. It opens the conversation
tab so you can find
info. It costs nothing but
you can't move until you
finish in the tab.

Dash and Hold. are different
methods of ending your turn
early. Dash decreases your initiative allowing
 you to act sooner. Hold increases your initiative
allowing you to do more but act later.

inputs: What is with the other robot?
inputs._: What is all this UI for?

inputs: What is with the other robot?
inputs._: What is all this UI for?

What is with the other robot?.response:
He is a enemy, however he is 
currently harmless and
just randomly walks around.
He ensures your game
doesn't crash through you
breaking the turn system

inputs: How does the turn system work?
inputs._: What is all this UI for?

That's everything thanks.response:
Awesome goodbye. There is no way to 
Go back through the
conversation so have fun!!

response:
There are 5 pieces of ui. This tab is the 
conversation tab. If you
interact with a POI or talk
to someone this will
appear. The large piece in
the bottom corner is the
main ui. it allows you to
open the inventory and the
conversation tab.

In the bottom right
is the display tab it
controls what you see on
screen.

the top left piece
is the inventory tab. It is
useless currently.

inputs: How does the turn system work?
inputs._: What is with the other robot?_That's everything thanks

tutorial_final.initiate: I have come to the final terminal
tutorial_final.response:
Yes! this is it.
You can always come back here,
but as long as the door is open you are not safe!

Never Mind.initiate:
I won't be safe? I'd rather stay here thanks.
Let me read the instructions again.
Never Mind.response:
Very well. If you wish to leave just
interact with this terminal

Open The Door!.initiate:
Okay, open the door! I am ready for this.
Let me Leave please
response: Opening Bay Doors
Ready for departure.

tutorial_terminal.initiate: So what do I do here?
response: Booting T.E.R.M.I.N.A.L systems....
DONE.

This is a standard Melclex terminal

This machine often has lots of useful data on it.
though often it will not have the personal touch
a note might have

Terminals can also open doors or turn off laser gates

tutorial_board.initiate: I just see a board with a note on in.
tutorial_board.response:
On the board there is a single piece of paper:
it reads:
'Hello! Notes are less formal than a terminal entry,
but can still have important information'

tutorial_gun.initiate: So what do I do here?
response: Booting T.E.R.M.I.N.A.L systems....
DONE.

This is a standard Melclex terminal

This machine often has lots of useful data on it.
though often it will not have the personal touch
a note might have

Terminals can also open doors or turn off laser gates

lobby_terminal_1.initiate:
Welcome to the Institute of Advanced Robotics.
If you were expected please sign in.
Remember you safety is our No. 1 priority.
No matter what security class you hold else where
you are still a guest here.

Thank you for joining us here at the IAR.
lobby_terminal_1.response: Oh yeah, I'm real excited for this.

Login as a guest..initiate:
Unfortunately there are no registered visitors
today. If this is a mistake or you would like to
register please contact IAR admin Max Caplin.

Sorry for the inconvenience. We hope to see you
again sometime.
Login as a guest..response:
I don't know what good that would do for me
anyway.

Exit System.initiate:
Exiting system.
Thank you for coming to the
Institute of Advanced Robotics
Exit System.response:
Yeah, I'm in love with the atmosphere already.
So welcoming.

News.initiate:
A small Quanta-net window opens.
Large red text scrolls across the top

"ERROR: QUANTANET KEY DISCONNECTED.
Window running off back-up."
The error is dated for 17 cycles ago.

There are only 2 "recent" news articles.
News.response: Interesting, I wonder if I can find that back-up.

initiate:
The same error continues to scroll across the top.

After an agonisingly slow loading time
a small article appears.

GETTING READY FOR TRIENNIAL OPPOSITION.
the author is Arthur Coldheim,
Managing Director of the
Melclex Industries Institute of Advanced Sciences.

Hello Everyone! M.D Arthur here. Its that time again.
There will be a 4 day holiday
as the suns begin their opposition.
So don't get caught slacking or you'll miss out!
Remember that QUANTA-net will be down for all 13
months. We have a 960 Terabyte back-up so there
shouldn't be any pages missing. Slowdowns,
however, are expected.

Have a good opposition.
I'll see you all at work again next week.
Prepping for Triennial Opposition..response:
That means the distress signal was relayed
the day their holiday started.
Worrying.

initiate:
The same error continues to scroll across the top.

After loading for worryingly long the article loads.

ISSUED WARNING FOR HOUSING SECTOR 19.
The author is IAR admin Max Caplin.
It was written 2 days into the opposition.

An electromagnetic anomaly has been detected
in Housing Sector 9. Security engineers are on
scene. All those who live in Sector 9 must stay in
Temporary Housing in sector 32.

There is no need for alarm, and it should not stop
your work. Continue everything as normal.

If you have been moved follow the security engineers
they will show you where to go.

Your family, and your necessary personal
belongings have been moved.

UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCE MAY YOU
RETURN TO YOUR HOUSING EARLY.

Doing so can have dire consequences on your career,
and can result in confinement.
Issued Warning for housing sector 19..response:
There was no way to access Sector 9.
I need to see if there
are other notes on this.

initiate:
Welcome to the Institute of Advanced Robotics.
your security is our top priority. NEVER leave your
guide. By ignoring these rules you are putting 
everyone in unnecessary risk. 

No matter what job you have within the Institute of
Advanced Research if you are not an IAR employee
you are a GUEST, and must act accordingly.

RULES:
1. Only follow your guide, do not try access doors
you do not have access to. Doing so is an offence.

2. All technology shown within is confidential.
DO NOT share, even within the Melclex Industries.

3. At all times keep your devices in our lockers or
set to minimal. This is for YOUR SAFETY.
Visitor Rules.response:
yes sir. Not that I have a guide.
I wonder why the rule about devices.

lobby_terminal_2.initiate:
Welcome u382heuyREH42. SECURITY LEVEL 1.

ERROR 21160, Physical alteration to this terminal
has occurred within 76 hours. Security officers have
been dispatched.

ERROR 13991, Occurred During Debugging Error 21160,
Stable communications cannot be made, Reattempting

ERROR -233, recursion depth exceeded 9998 attempts.
lobby_terminal_2.response:
Uhm. That's an interesting greeting message.
Who is u382heuyREH42?
the scans showed no life signatures.

Due to major secruity breaches there will be

lobby_board.initiate:
A tired looking cork board leans on the wall.

A small photo is stuck above an ancient looking
news paper.

A big, and bright poster stamped with the rules of
the IAR.
lobby_board.response: What an exciting looking board. So welcoming.

initiate:
A small printed image of a group standing around a
21st century style robot. In the background there
is a tall building with original Melclex symbol on
it.

Below it is a small news paper clipping dated for
13th july 2086. Talking of the creation of the IAR
branch.
response: How sweet. Machines have really improved.

initiate:
What a greeeat entrance to the lab.
Makes me sooooo excited to be here.

THE SERVER ROOM IS A SECURED AREA.
ONlY PERSONNEL WITH LEVEL 1 SECURITY
MAY ENTER
ENTERING THIS ROOM WITHOUT PROPER CLEARANCE
IS A CRIME.

:AUTOMATED: RELEASE ALL SECURITY LEVEL 1.
All personnel with the correct password may now
enter.

Enter Password.response:
PASSWORD ENTERED.
ACCESS TO HIGHER LEVEL CONTROLS GRANTED.

OPEN SERVER ROOM DOOR.response:
Easy Peasy.
17 months really makes Security lax.

CURRENT ACTIVE EMPLOYEES WITH DRIVE ACCESS:

server_room_terminal.response:
Who ever came through here before me
